According to the retrieved context from Networking Fundamentals -1--.pdf, Page: 1, a Local Area Network (LAN) is defined as "a group of computers that are confined to a small geographic area, usually one building." This is stated on page 2 of the document. 

So, the answer to your question is:

A local area network (LAN) is a group of computers that are confined to a small geographic area, usually one building.
